--- title: Predictive decisioning 300-level live demo description: Predictive decisioning 300-level live demo tabs: [ 'Demo preparation', 'Demo script'] --- export const Title = () => ( Predictive decisioning
300-level live demo ); | DEMO OVERVIEW | | | :--- | :--- | | **Scenario overview** | | | **Demo products** | Cloud Pak for Business Automation (CP4BA), Cloud Pak for Data | | **Demo capabilities** | | | **Demo video** | | | **Key demo considerations** | This demo script has multiple tasks, that each have multiple steps. In each step, you have the details about what you need to do (**Actions**), what you can say while delivering this demo step (**Narration**), and what diagrams and screenshots you will see (**Screenshots**). This demo script is a suggestion, and you are welcome to customize based in your sales opportunity. Most importantly, practice this demo in advance. If the demo seems easy for you to execute, the customer will focus on the content. If it seems difficult for you to execute, the customer will focus on your delivery. | | **How to get support** | #Techdemos-Automation-Support Slack channel |
**INSTALL THE DEMO**
Prerequisites
Before proceeding with the steps below, please download the following files:
• [Customer churn data](./customer-churn-data.csv)
• [Customer LTV data](./customer-LTV-data.csv)
• [Retention policy](./Retention-Policy.pdf)
• [Telco retention application](./Telco_Retention_Application-V20.twx)
• [Telco retention decision service](./Telco-retention-decision-service-V10.zip)

These files will be referenced in the steps below.

**PREPARE TO GIVE THE DEMO** The setup process is illustrated in the following chart. Each number icon corresponds to the respective preparation step below.
![Demo Setup Process](./images/0-demo-installation-process_600.png) ### 1 - Provision your demo environment The Automation Decision Services (ADS) demo is simply based on the Telco retention sample provided in the default ADS install.
You must install CP4BA 21.0.2 or provision ROKS environment that will be available for 2 weeks at no charge.
This document explains how to get a free pre-configured Cloud Pak for Business Automation environment:
Reserve your CP4BA preconfigured environment on ROKS
1. Log in to the IBM Technology Zone using your IBM ID. Then, click on the **Activation Kits** tab.

![TechZone](./images/1-Techzone_600.png)

2. Scroll down to click on the **Cloud Pak for Business Automation** tile.

![CP4BA Activation Kit](./images/1-CP4BA_Activation_Kit_600.png)

3. Click on the **Environments - Reserve Here!** tab. Then, select the **Reserve Here! - Cloud Pak for Business Automation OpenShift Demo Environments** tile.

4. Click on the **Preinstalled OpenShift Environments** tab. Then, select the latest version of the **Preinstalled CP4BA on Red Hat OpenShift on IBM Cloud**.

5. Select **Reserve now**. Then, after entering the **Purpose**, **Preferred Geography**, and **Notes**, click on **Submit**.

6. When you are done, you will see a confirmation message. In addition, you will receive a confirmation email with all the access links.

![Confirmation](./images/1-Confirmation_600.png)

![Confirmation Email](./images/1-Confirmation_email_600.png)

7. Then, you will receive an email confirming that your instance is provisioned. It may take 30 to 45 minutes.

![Instance Provisioned](./images/1-Ready_email_600.png)

**[Go to top](#top)**
Access your provisioned CP4BA environment
1. Log in to the IBM Technology Zone.

2. At the top right corner, click on the **Profile** icon. Then, click on **Reservations**. You will then be directed to the **My reservations** page, in which you can see your reservation details. Note: Bookmark this page for ease of reference.

![Reservations](./images/2-Reservations_600.png)

![My Reservations](./images/2-My_Reservations_600.png)

3. Once it's provisioned, your instance should look like the screenshot below.

![Provisioned Instance](./images/2-Provisioned_Instance_600.png)

**[Go to top](#top)**
Access your OpenShift instance
When your instance is provisioned, you should receive a confirmation email with the access links. If the links are not attached to the email, please refer to the steps below.

1. Go to the START HERE section in your OpenShift Instance. Note: The link is also provided in the confirmation email.

![IBM Technology Zone](./images/3-Start_Here_600.png)

2. Click to open the **README.md** file, and scroll down to click on **Preinstalled Cluster**. Under **Instructions**, click on **2 - Wait for your cluster** to expand the section and follow step 2.2.

3. From your **Reservation** page, double-click on your instance, and copy your **Environment ID**.

![Environment ID](./images/3-EnvironmentID_600.png)

4. Log in to your IBM Cloud account.

5. On the top menu, swap to the **DTESQUAD** account.

![DTESQUAD](./images/3-DTE_Squad_600.png)

6. From the **Clusters** menu, search for your cluster using the **Environment ID** that was copied from step 3.

![Clusters](./images/3-Cluster_Menu_600.png)

7. Check that your cluster's state is green, and double-click on it. Check that your **Ingress subdomain** is set up, and open your **OpenShift web console**.

8. Open the **Workloads** menu, and select **Config Maps**. Then, set your project to **dtecp4ba**.

9. Search for **access** to access the **icp4Adeploy-cp4ba-access-info** file. Open this file to access all your access links and credentials to the various environments. Note: You have the **ADS-runtime-access-info** in that file as well.

![Access](./images/3-Access_600.png)

10. The important link ie the **BAStudio URL**. From this URL, you will be able to access the key elements of the demo:
• Business Automation Studio
• Application Designer
• Automation Decision Services

11. You are now ready to set up the demo. Open **BAStudio** from the ADS link in the access file.

**[Go to top](#top)**
### 2 - Watson Studio setup
Set up your Watson Studio account
1. Click here to log in to your IBM Cloud account, or create a new one.

2. Click on **Catalog** at the top, and type **Watson Studio** in the search menu. Then, select **Watson Studio Lite**.

![Watson Studio](./images/2-1-Watson_Studio_600.png)

![Watson Studio Lite](./images/2-1-Watson_Studio_Lite_600.png)

3. Select a location for your service. Select the **Lite** plan (free), and click **Create**.

4. Once it's provisioned, click on **Get Started**.

**[Go to top](#top)**
Create your deployment space
1. Click on **New deployment space**.

![Get Started](./images/2-1-Get_Started_600.png)

2. Give a name to your deployment space (e.g., [your name]-deployment-space).

3. Create your **Cloud Object Storage** service.
a. Go in the **Select object service** section, and click **Create**.
b. Select the **Lite** version, and click **Create**.

4. Select your machine learning (ML) service.
a. Go in the **Select machine learning service (optional)** section, and click **Create**. Then, select your location.
b. Select the **Lite** version, and click **Create**.
c. Click on **Select a machine learning service**, and scroll to select your newly created ML service.
d. Click on **Create** (bottom right of the screen), and let the deployment space creation run.
e. Once it's done, you should see a **The space is ready** message. Click on **View new space** to see your new deployment space.

![Preparing Space](./images/2-2-Space_Preparing_600.png)

![Space Ready](./images/2-2-Space_Ready_600.png)

**[Go to top](#top)**
Check the services installed
1. Click on the **Menu** icon (top left corner).

![Space](./images/2-2-View_Space_600.png)

2. Click on **Services**, and then select **Service instances**.

![Services](./images/2-3-Services_600.png)

3. You should now see your 3 newly created services.

![Service Instances](./images/2-3-Service_Instances_600.png)

**[Go to top](#top)**
Create a new project
1. Click on **IBM Watson Studio**, and then click on **New project**.

2. Select **Create an empty project, and enter details for your project. Once it's created, you'll have an empty project.

3. Click on **Add to project** and add the **AutoAI experiment**.

![Empty Project](./images/2-4-Empty_Project_600.png)

![Choose Asset Type](./images/2-4-Add_AutoAI_600.png)

4. Enter a name for your experiment. Example: LOT-Customer retention demo experiment

5. Click on **Associate a Machine Learning service instance**.

6. Select your ML service instance, and click on **Associate service** in the blue ribbon.

![Associate service](./images/2-4-Associate_Service_600.png)

7. In the AutoAI configuration menu, click on **Reload**. Your ML service should now show up.

8. At the bottom right corner, click on **Create* to create your ML experiment in Watson Studio. Once it's completed, your AutoAI experiment is ready to be set up.

**[Go to top](#top)**
Set up your churn ML service
1. Under **Add data sources**, click on **Browse**.

![Project](./images/2-4-Project_Ready_600.png)

2. Select the **customer-churn-data.csv** file. Note: This data file was already downloaded as one of the [prerequisites](#install-the-demo).

![Select File](./images/2-5-Select_File_600.png)

3. Select the prediction criteria by following the steps below.

a. Click on **Select prediction column**.

![Prediction Column](./images/2-5-Prediction_Column_600.png)

b. Select **CHURN**.

![Churn](./images/2-5-Churn_600.png)

c. Click on **Run experiment**. Your AutoAI run will begin, and it should take around five minutes. Once it's done, the progress map's status will read **Experiment completed**.

![Run Experiment](./images/2-5-Run_Experiment_600.png)

![Experiment Summary](./images/2-5-Experiment_600.png)

![Experiment Completed](./images/2-5-Experiment_Completed_600.png)

d. Click on the first row in the **Pipeline leaderboard**, and then select **Save as**.

![Pipeline Leaderboard](./images/2-5-Pipeline_600.png)

e. Select **Model**, and click on **Create**. Then, you should see a **Saved model successfully** notification.

![Model Details](./images/2-5-Model_600.png)

f. Return to the project view by clicking on the ML experiment in the breadcrumb navigation bar. You should now see your Watson Machine Learning (WML) model listed.

![Navigation Bar](./images/2-5-Breadcrumb_600.png)

![WML](./images/2-5-WML_600.png)

**[Go to top](#top)**
Set up the LTV ML service
1. Follow the steps below to add the Customer LTV CSV to your data assets.

a. Click on **New Data asset**, and select **browse**.
![Project View](./images/2-5-WML_600.png)

b. Select the **customer-LTV-data.csv** file. Note: This data file was already downloaded as one of the [prerequisites](#install-the-demo).
![Select File](./images/2-6-Select_File_600.png)

c. The file should now appear in your list under **Data assets**.
![Data Assets](./images/2-6-Data_Assets_600.png)

2. Follow the steps below to create a new AutoAI experiment.

a. Click on **New AutoAI experiment**, and enter details for your experiment. Make sure the ML service is associated to your experiment. Then, click **Create**.

![New AutoAI Experiment](./images/2-6-New_AutoAI_600.png)

b. Under **Add data sources**, click on **Select from project**. Select the **customer-LTV-data.csv** file, and click on **Select Asset**.

![Add Data Sources](./images/2-6-Add_Data-Sources_600.png)

![Select Data Asset](./images/2-6-Select_Data_Asset_600.png)

c. Under the **What do you want to predict?** section, select **LTV**. ![LTV](./images/2-6-LTV_600.png)

d. Click on **Run experiment**. The experiment should last around five minutes. Once it's done, the progress map's status will read **Experiment completed**.

![Run Experiment](./images/2-6-Run_Experiment_600.png)

![Experiment Completed](./images/2-6-Experiment_Completed_600.png)

e. Click on the first row in the **Pipeline leaderboard**. It is marked with a black star on the left column. Then, click **Save as**.

![Pipeline Leaderboard](./images/2-6-Pipeline_Leaderboard_600.png)

f. Select **Model**, and click on **Create**. Then, you should see a **Saved model successfully** notification.

![Model Details](./images/2-6-Model_600.png)

g. Click on the project to return to the project view. You should now see that the model has been created and listed.

![Navigation Bar](./images/2-6-Breadcrumb_600.png)

![WML](./images/2-6-WML_600.png)

**[Go to top](#top)**
#### Deploy the models in the deployment environment Your free quota will be consumed as long as the models are deployed.
Deploy the models before the demonstration, and undeploy them as soon as the demo is done to not be overcharged and to save your free monthly quota.
Deploy the LTV service
1. Select the LTV model and click on the **ellipsis** icon. Then, click on **Promote**.

![LTV Model Menu](./images/2-7-Promote_600.png)

2. Select your deployment space that was previously created. Click on **Promote**.

3. Repeat steps 1 and 2 with the customer churn model.

4. Click on **IBM Watson Studio** (top left corner). Select **Deployments** and then **View all spaces**.

5. Select the **Spaces** tab, and click on your deployment space.

6. In the **Assets** tab, you should see your two models that are ready to be executed.

7. At this point, nothing is deployed yet. You will be charged as soon as you execute the models. If you click on the **Deployments** tab, there should be no deployments to monitor.

8. In the **Assets** tab, select the LTV model and click on the **rocket** icon to start the service.

9. Give a name to the deployment, and click **Create**. When it's deployed, you should see the deployment message.

10. Repeat steps 6 to 10 for the customer churn model.

11. Click on the **Deployments** tab to see the services that are deployed. You will be charged until you undeploy the services after the demonstration.

12. Get the Deployment ID to configure ADS. In the **Deployments** list, click on **Churn Service**. Then, copy the **Deployment ID**. Repeat step 12 to get the **Deployment ID** for the LTV service as well.

**[Go to top](#top)**
Undeploy the service after the demo
1.

**[Go to top](#top)**
Redeploy services for a new demo
1.

**[Go to top](#top)**
